channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2025050153
item.description:
Report E-2025050153

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-02
  • City: FOSTORIA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 05/02/2025, at 16:35 hours, personnel in the CSXT Fostoria, Ohio Yard discovered SIRX525280, a loaded hopper car of Ferrous Sulfate, leaking from the A-end slide gate. The car was isolated and the shipper, SEM Minerals, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025-05-02-00202). SPSI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the A-end slide gate open approximately 1-2” and spilling product. Contractor personnel applied plugging material to the slide gate door to secure the leak, as it could not be closed full. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Keith Mizwicki).
